availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Harrison Baker (Caldwell county, kentucky, student and farm laborer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, student and farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel Baker and Martha C. Groom Baker. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned eight enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farm laborer and student in Caldwell County in 1860. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 363B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 787.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 17.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Burnesville, p. 208A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #21007.
"Henry Harrison Baker (1841-1912)," Find A Grave, Memorial #204827247, accessed July 20, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/204827247.
